member.name: T:SuperSimpleTcp.ConnectionEventArgs
member.summary: Arguments for connection events.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.ConnectionEventArgs.IpPort
member.summary: The IP address and port number of the connected peer socket.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.ConnectionEventArgs.Reason
member.summary: The reason for the disconnection, if any.

member.name: T:SuperSimpleTcp.DataReceivedEventArgs
member.summary: Arguments for data received from connected endpoints.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.DataReceivedEventArgs.IpPort
member.summary: The IP address and port number of the connected endpoint.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.DataReceivedEventArgs.Data
member.summary: The data received from the endpoint.

member.name: T:SuperSimpleTcp.DataSentEventArgs
member.summary: Arguments for data sent to a connected endpoint.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.DataSentEventArgs.IpPort
member.summary: The IP address and port number of the connected endpoint.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.DataSentEventArgs.BytesSent
member.summary: The number of bytes sent.

member.name: T:SuperSimpleTcp.DisconnectReason
member.summary: Reason why a client disconnected.

member.name: F:SuperSimpleTcp.DisconnectReason.Normal
member.summary: Normal disconnection.

member.name: F:SuperSimpleTcp.DisconnectReason.Kicked
member.summary: Client connection was intentionally terminated programmatically or by the server.

member.name: F:SuperSimpleTcp.DisconnectReason.Timeout
member.summary: Client connection timed out; server did not receive data within the timeout window.

member.name: F:SuperSimpleTcp.DisconnectReason.None
member.summary: The connection was not disconnected.

member.name: T:SuperSimpleTcp.PermitType
member.summary: PermitType's used to clarify the way to validate permitted IPs

member.name: F:SuperSimpleTcp.PermitType.OnlyPermittedList
member.summary: Only PermittedList is used when only the PermittedIPs list decides

member.name: F:SuperSimpleTcp.PermitType.FlagAndPermittedList
member.summary: FlagAndPermittedList is used to check the flag AllowAnonymousIPs first and if the flag was false then checks the PermittedIPs list

member.name: T:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClient

member.name: T:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientEvents
member.summary: SimpleTcp client events.

member.name: E:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientEvents.Connected
member.summary: Event to call when the connection is established.

member.name: E:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientEvents.Disconnected
member.summary: Event to call when the connection is destroyed.

member.name: E:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientEvents.DataReceived
member.summary: Event to call when byte data has become available from the server.

member.name: E:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientEvents.DataSent
member.summary: Event to call when byte data has been sent to the server.

member.name: M:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientEvents.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiate the object.

member.name: T:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientSettings
member.summary: SimpleTcp client settings.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientSettings.LocalEndpoint
member.summary: The System.Net.IPEndPoint to which you bind the TCP System.Net.Sockets.Socket.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientSettings.NoDelay
member.summary: Nagle's algorithm. Gets or sets a value that disables a delay when send or receive buffers are not full. true if the delay is disabled; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientSettings.StreamBufferSize
member.summary: Buffer size to use while interacting with streams.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientSettings.ConnectTimeoutMs
member.summary: The number of milliseconds to wait when attempting to connect.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientSettings.ReadTimeoutMs
member.summary: The number of milliseconds to wait when attempting to read before returning null.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientSettings.IdleServerTimeoutMs
member.summary: Maximum amount of time to wait before considering the server to be idle and disconnecting from it. By default, this value is set to 0, which will never disconnect due to inactivity. The timeout is reset any time a message is received from the server. For instance, if you set this value to 30000, the client will disconnect if the server has not sent a message to the client within 30 seconds.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientSettings.IdleServerEvaluationIntervalMs
member.summary: Number of milliseconds to wait between each iteration of evaluating the server connection to see if the configured timeout interval has been exceeded.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientSettings.ConnectionLostEvaluationIntervalMs
member.summary: Number of milliseconds to wait between each iteration of evaluating the server connection to see if the connection is lost.

member.name: F:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientSettings.AcceptInvalidCertificates
member.summary: Enable or disable acceptance of invalid SSL certificates.

member.name: F:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientSettings.MutuallyAuthenticate
member.summary: Enable or disable mutual authentication of SSL client and server.

member.name: F:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientSettings.UseAsyncDataReceivedEvents
member.summary: Enable or disable whether the data receiver thread fires the DataReceived event from a background task. The default is enabled.

member.name: F:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientSettings.CheckCertificateRevocation
member.summary: Enable or disable checking certificate revocation list during the validation process.

member.name: F:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientSettings.CertificateValidationCallback
member.summary: Delegate responsible for validating a certificate supplied by a remote party.

member.name: M:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpClientSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiate the object.

member.name: T:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpKeepaliveSettings
member.summary: SimpleTcp keepalive settings. Keepalive probes are sent after an idle period defined by TcpKeepAliveTime (seconds). Should a keepalive response not be received within TcpKeepAliveInterval (seconds), a subsequent keepalive probe will be sent. For .NET Framework, should 10 keepalive probes fail, the connection will terminate. For .NET Core, should a number of probes fail as specified in TcpKeepAliveRetryCount, the connection will terminate. TCP keepalives are not supported in .NET Standard.

member.name: F:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpKeepaliveSettings.EnableTcpKeepAlives
member.summary: Enable or disable TCP-based keepalive probes. TCP keepalives are only supported in .NET Core and .NET Framework projects. .NET Standard does not provide facilities to support TCP keepalives.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpKeepaliveSettings.TcpKeepAliveInterval
member.summary: TCP keepalive interval, i.e. the number of seconds a TCP connection will wait for a keepalive response before sending another keepalive probe. Default is 5 seconds. Value must be greater than zero.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpKeepaliveSettings.TcpKeepAliveTime
member.summary: TCP keepalive time, i.e. the number of seconds a TCP connection will remain alive/idle before keepalive probes are sent to the remote. Default is 5 seconds. Value must be greater than zero.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpKeepaliveSettings.TcpKeepAliveRetryCount
member.summary: TCP keepalive retry count, i.e. the number of times a TCP probe will be sent in effort to verify the connection. After the specified number of probes fail, the connection will be terminated.

member.name: M:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpKeepaliveSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiate the object.

member.name: T:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerEvents
member.summary: SimpleTcp server events.

member.name: E:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerEvents.ClientConnected
member.summary: Event to call when a client connects.

member.name: E:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerEvents.ClientDisconnected
member.summary: Event to call when a client disconnects.

member.name: E:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerEvents.DataReceived
member.summary: Event to call when byte data has become available from the client.

member.name: E:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerEvents.DataSent
member.summary: Event to call when byte data has been sent to a client.

member.name: M:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerEvents.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiate the object.

member.name: T:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerSettings
member.summary: SimpleTcp server settings.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerSettings.NoDelay
member.summary: Nagle's algorithm. Gets or sets a value that disables a delay when send or receive buffers are not full. true if the delay is disabled; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerSettings.StreamBufferSize
member.summary: Buffer size to use while interacting with streams.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerSettings.IdleClientTimeoutMs
member.summary: Maximum amount of time to wait before considering a client idle and disconnecting them. By default, this value is set to 0, which will never disconnect a client due to inactivity. The timeout is reset any time a message is received from a client. For instance, if you set this value to 30000, the client will be disconnected if the server has not received a message from the client within 30 seconds.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerSettings.MaxConnections
member.summary: Maximum number of connections the server will accept. Default is 4096. Value must be greater than zero.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerSettings.IdleClientEvaluationIntervalMs
member.summary: Number of milliseconds to wait between each iteration of evaluating connected clients to see if they have exceeded the configured timeout interval.

member.name: F:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerSettings.AcceptInvalidCertificates
member.summary: Enable or disable acceptance of invalid SSL certificates.

member.name: F:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerSettings.MutuallyAuthenticate
member.summary: Enable or disable mutual authentication of SSL client and server.

member.name: F:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerSettings.UseAsyncDataReceivedEvents
member.summary: Enable or disable whether the data receiver thread fires the DataReceived event from a background task. The default is enabled.

member.name: F:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerSettings.CheckCertificateRevocation
member.summary: Enable or disable checking certificate revocation list during the validation process.

member.name: F:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerSettings.CertificateValidationCallback
member.summary: Delegate responsible for validating a certificate supplied by a remote party.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerSettings.PermittedIPs
member.summary: The list of permitted IP addresses from which connections can be received.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerSettings.BlockedIPs
member.summary: The list of blocked IP addresses from which connections will be declined.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerSettings.PermitType
member.summary: This property indicates in which way validate IPs

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerSettings.AllowAnonymousIPs
member.summary: The AllowAnonymousIPs flag to know if permitted IPs list should be checked or not.

member.name: M:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpServerSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiate the object.

member.summary: SimpleTcp statistics.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpStatistics.StartTime
member.summary: The time at which the client or server was started.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpStatistics.UpTime
member.summary: The amount of time which the client or server has been up.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpStatistics.ReceivedBytes
member.summary: The number of bytes received.

member.name: P:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpStatistics.SentBytes
member.summary: The number of bytes sent.

member.name: M:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpStatistics.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize the statistics object.

member.name: M:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpStatistics.ToString
member.summary: Return human-readable version of the object.

member.name: M:SuperSimpleTcp.SimpleTcpStatistics.Reset
member.summary: Reset statistics other than StartTime and UpTime.
